result: A) 2 months and mealfinalidade: The time it takes for the water level to reach zero is equal to the total volume of water divided by the rate at which the water is being added or removed from the reservoir. In this case, the water level is decreasing linearly, so we can use the formula: t = (V / r) * ln(1 - e^(-r*t))where V is the volume of water in the reservoir, r is the rate at which the water is being added or removed, and t is the time. Plugging in the values, we get:t = (35% / 0.1) * ln(1 - e^(-0.1*6))= 2 months and half
